content.description: Pretty hard opening moves, so keep the belayer attentive. Great technical movement with small holds. A must do, even for this canyon.
content.location: Starts left of the right arête on the east facing section. Can start on arête and traverse in for easier start.

content.description: Fun repel, but the bolts are a bit low so it makes it a bit dodge trying to lower yourself. Great view from top. Watch out for loose rocks. The trail getting the cliff is on a steep hill and takes about 5 min.
content.protection: Two fixed bolts at top, will need quick draws.
content.location: The route is on the left side of the cliff. Easiest way is to repel down to the bottom, or you can hike down on the left side (just be careful of sketchy loose rocks!). Easily seen from road. Use dirt trail from parking to get to the cliff.

content.description: Feels like sustained technical bouldering from the ground to the chains. Fabulous rock quality
content.location: Furthest route to the left on the east facing side

content.description: Basically climb the arete until the steep budge and then bust out left on the thin face.
content.location: The fin has a portion that looks like a column from the road. As it is the only part of the cliff that faces the road. The start is the left side of the column looking thing, which is a long arete

content.description: Gots a bunch a coool moves on it. Some arête, some face, some bulgy fun at the top.
content.location: Goes straight up the face of what looks like a pillar, on the end of the Fin facing the creek.
